Θ×δ.Θ∘δ: Deviation with explicit polarity tagging (e.g., positive vs negative deviation).
Θ×δ.commutation: \[Θ, δ\] describes how polarity routing interacts with deviation geometry.

Θ×Φ.role: Separates positive/negative semantic contributions on projected forms.

Θ×Π.link\_to\_logic: Forms basis for logic gates on evaluation outputs.

Θ×Σ.Σ∘Θ: Summation of polarized states then tagging.

Θ×μ.Θ∘μ: Polarity-tagged local density (e.g., attractive vs repulsive weight).

Θ×λ.Θ∘λ: Curvature with polarity (e.g., positive vs negative curvature channels).

Θ×χ.Θ∘χ: Evolution of polarity state over semantic time.
Θ×χ.χ∘Θ: Time parameter applied to polarity configuration.

Θ×Ω.Θ∘Ω: Global constraints with polarity (e.g., allowed/forbidden regions tagged).
Θ×Ω.role: Global logic constraints on semantic states.

Θ internal (logic-gate level).Θ\_LG(AND): Construct AND gate via polarity rules and Π outputs.
Θ internal (logic-gate level).Θ\_LG(NOT): Construct negation gate on single polarity input.

Θ⊕ / Θ⊗.Θ⊕: Additive composition of polarity states (boolean-like sum).
Θ⊕ / Θ⊗.Θ⊗: Tensorized polarity grid for multi-channel logic.
Θ⊕ / Θ⊗.use: Build complex logic networks and polarity tensors.

Θ-Polarity Table.combination\_rules: Defines how polarity values combine under Θ⊕ and Θ⊗.
Θ-Polarity Table.logic\_mapping: Associates polarity states with Boolean truth-values for Π outputs.
